level.text: 2307.1 For the purposes of §§ 203(a)(2), 203(a)(3), and 203(a)(4) of the Act,he following records shall be used to determine whether there is prima facievidence of a disqualification:
A criminal history record information (as defined in 28 CFR § 20.3(d))ith a disposition showing a conviction or a sentence (including a suspendedentence, probation, incarceration, or a fine); or
A court record showing a conviction or a sentence.
2307.2 Only convictions rendered by the courts of the several states,erritories, possessions, and federal tribunals, including those of theilitary, shall be considered.

2307.3 The pendency of an appeal, or of any other judicial or non-judicialeview, shall not be considered until the entry of a final order setting asidehe conviction. Non-judicial review includes the pardon authority of theurisdiction where the conviction was obtained.
2307.4 The time period preceding an application for registration shall beomputed by using the date of the applicant’s signature on form P.D. 219 ashe end of the period of time to be computed.
